using wubi won't make a non-working-in-ubuntu wifi card work, it's not like using a virtual machine
wubi more or less uses the windows bootloader to bootstrap a virtual parition image stored on your windows partition
if you're just playing around with ubuntu it's totally fine
you've got a bunch of options - use ubuntu in a VM, replace the wifi card, or use a USB wireless card
